Au(s) | QH 2 | QH X ( 0.01 M ) | Ag(1M) | Ag(s) E cell = + 0.4 V \text{Au(s) | QH}_2\text{ | QH}_X(0.01 M) \, \text{| Ag(1M) | Ag(s) } \, E_{\text{cell}} = +0.4V Au(s) | QH 2 ​ | QH X ​ ( 0.01 M ) | Ag(1M) | Ag(s) E cell ​ = + 0.4 V The couple QH/Q represents quinhydrone electrode, the half cell reaction is given below: QH 2 → Q + 2 e − + 2 H + E QH / Q ∘ = + 0.7 V \text{QH}_2 \rightarrow \text{Q} + 2e^- + 2H^+ \, E^\circ_{\text{QH}/\text{Q}} = +0.7V QH 2 ​ → Q + 2 e − + 2 H + E QH / Q ∘ ​ = + 0.7 V

Given: R = 0.08 dm 3 bar K -1 mol -1 Assume only methanol is formed as the product and the system follows ideal gas behaviour.
